TopicTitle: Engine has changed thrust Poodle now 56 (ish ) kn of thrust.

Articles.Content:
Before i start pulling my gamadata folder apart my game was already modded, just installed a few more , done a few more sat missions, built a transfer stage for another mission and the Poodle now has 56kn of thrust in vac, can anyone ID the mod so i can scrap it 56kn of thrust in vac makes the engine entirely useless.

![9hlZPHY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9hlZPHY.jpg)

Any realism tweaks?

You may be glitching, and the game thinks you are in some atmosphere. Try restarting.

What's your mod list?
Since it has also replaced the model with something else entirely, that seems to be from a pretty comprehensive overhaul project. Something like RO or SETI.

Got it something had changed the Squad folder in Gamedata, downloaded a fresh copy of KSP and replced the one in my modded copy.

I'll try to figure which mod did it

...Wha-? ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) Something like that should never happen. If you manage to figure it out, and it was intentional (not an install error or the like), please talk to the mod author about it. It's a huge no-no to do this. No mod should touch the Squad folder.
IIRC Ven's Stock Revamp changes the Poodle to be the "Service Engine", perhaps that's the one making the changes.

> 
> IIRC Ven's Stock Revamp changes the Poodle to be the "Service Engine", perhaps that's the one making the changes.

^^^ Yup thats the one, it also appears to have screwed with some fuel tank adapters and the Mk.1 Liquid Fuel tank size, that tanks are now a smaller size dia and length but the connection nodes are still the same so connecting two nodes leaves a massive gap.

I do like the look of the new models though.

> 
> ...Wha-? ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) Something like that should never happen. If you manage to figure it out, and it was intentional (not an install error or the like), please talk to the mod author about it. It's a huge no-no to do this. No mod should touch the Squad folder.

Yeah, this mod needs some rewriting. I'm sure some rather extensive Module Manager coding could do the trick.
Ven's Stock Revamp has used non-destructive MM patching for, like, 3 months now.
